Job Title: Director of Development

Location: Denver Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Project Management

Description:
Macdonald & Company is partnered with a vertically-integrated real estate developer and investor to appoint a Director of Development into their development group.
The CompanyThe firm have a track-record spanning decades, and boast a portfolio of Multifamily, Affordable Housing, Hotel, and Office assets. They both develop ground-up projects, and invest in value-add/opportunistic deals, predominantly across the Denver Metro area.
With a reputation as a best-in-class developer, they have been on a steady growth trajectory of deals despite a tough climate, and now have a need to grow their development team to accommodate.
The PositionThe Development Director will support the investments team with acquisitions through deal analysis and due diligence, and will become more heavily involved on projects from permitting/design onwards, typically overseeing a combination of deals at any one time (market-rate Multifamily, Affordable Housing, Hotels etc.).
Core responsibilities include:Manage all aspects of the project design, budget, and scheduleManage project design team (architect, engineers, and other consultants) and project contractor during preconstruction design efforts and throughout the construction processCreate project milestone schedules and ensure that all team members meet schedule requirementsWork with local government other related parties to obtain necessary project permits and entitlementsNegotiate contracts, leases, and other critical legal documents to best mitigate project riskCompare contractor cost estimates, interview contractors, and assist in selecting the contractor that will best ensure success for the projectReview and approve project expenses, contractor pay applications, and change order requestsPrepare monthly lender draws and ensure compliance with lender loan agreementsOversee and direct work of Development Analysts & AssociatesConsult with Asset Management and Operations staff during pre-development, construction, and transfer of property to operationsAssist in analyzing potential new development projects by providing input for proformas, review of proformas, and writing portions of investment memosCreation of new processes and implementation of improvements to current processes/best practicesRegularly visit development sites to monitor and track project progress
On OfferCompetitive salary, annual bonus, milestone bonuses, carried interest participation.

Experience Level (if available): Director
